content:
TASK: Create CLI client for all six notebook operations.

CONTEXT: A command-line tool that AI coding agents (Claude Code, Copilot) can use directly. Human-friendly output for interactive use.

IMPLEMENTATION:

Binary crate: cli/notebook-cli

COMMANDS:
```
notebook write <notebook_id> --content "text" --type "text/plain" --topic "optional"
notebook revise <notebook_id> <entry_id> --content "new text" --reason "why"
notebook read <notebook_id> <entry_id> [--revision N]
notebook browse <notebook_id> [--query "search"] [--max-tokens 4000]
notebook share <notebook_id> <author_id> --read --write
notebook observe <notebook_id> [--since N]
notebook list
notebook create <name>
notebook delete <notebook_id>
```

CONFIGURATION:
- NOTEBOOK_URL env var (default: http://localhost:3000)
- NOTEBOOK_AUTHOR_ID env var (for auth)
- Config file: ~/.notebook/config.toml

OUTPUT:
- JSON by default (for programmatic use)
- --human flag for formatted output
- --quiet flag for minimal output

DEPENDENCIES:
- clap for argument parsing
- reqwest for HTTP
- tokio for async
- serde_json for JSON

ACCEPTANCE:
- All commands work against running server
- Help text is clear and complete
- Error messages are helpful
- Exit codes follow convention (0 success, 1 error)

REFERENCES: See API contract entry for endpoint details.
author: orchestrator
